Class HuffmanTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • HuffmanTree

  • public class HuffmanTree
extends java.lang.Object
    Proof of concept of Huffman Coding. Use a file content to build a HuffmanTree in order to encode the original text. This process will use less memory to store the content.
    Version:
    03/12/11
    Author:
    Chun-Wei Chen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HuffmanTree(java.io.File file)
      Constructs a HuffmanTree with a file passed in.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      HNode buildHuffmanTree()
      Builds the HuffmanTree for the file.
      java.lang.String decode()
      Returns the output of encoded message after decoded.
      java.lang.String encode()
      Returns the output of the file after encoded.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fillLookupTable()
      Fills a lookup table with keys -- characrters (in String) from the file and values -- the character after encoded (00, 101, etc.).
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,HNode> fillMap()
      Fills the map with keys -- characrters (in String) from the file and values -- the HNodes contain each character and its frequency.
      void lookupTableToString()
      String representation of the lookup table.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main method allows the user use JFileChooser to choose a file and do the Huffman coding, and then displays original text, freqeuncy table, encoded/decoded message, Huffman Tree, lookup table, and average number of bits per symbol used corresponding to the file.
      void showEverything()
      This methods show the original text, the symbol frequency table, the Huffman Tree (include the 'symbol' and 'frequency' value for each node), the symbol/code table, the encoded message, the decoded message, and the average number of bits per symbol used in the encoded file.
      void showFreqTable()
      Shows the frequency table, which displays each character and its frequency in each line.
      void treeToString()
      String represrntation of the HuffmanTree.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • HuffmanTree

        public HuffmanTree(java.io.File file)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a HuffmanTree with a file passed in.
        Parameters:
        file - a file object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file cannot be read
        java.io.IOException - signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred

    • Method Detail

      • fillMap

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,HNode> fillMap()
                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Fills the map with keys -- characrters (in String) from the file and values -- the HNodes contain each character and its frequency.
        Returns:
        a map contains keys -- characrters (in String) from the file and values -- the HNodes contain each character and its frequency
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred

      • buildHuffmanTree

        public HNode buildHuffmanTree()
        Builds the HuffmanTree for the file. Each leaf of the tree contains a character and its frequency. Other node only contain the frequency, the frequencies of its left and right child combined.
        Returns:
        the root of the tree.

      • fillLookupTable

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fillLookupTable()
        Fills a lookup table with keys -- characrters (in String) from the file and values -- the character after encoded (00, 101, etc.).
        Returns:
        a map contains keys -- characrters (in String) from the file and values -- the character after encoded (00, 101, etc.).

      • encode

        public java.lang.String encode()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the output of the file after encoded.
        Returns:
        the output of the file after encoded
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred

      • decode

        public java.lang.String decode()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the output of encoded message after decoded. This should be the same as the original file.
        Returns:
        the output of encoded message after decoded
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred

      • showFreqTable

        public void showFreqTable()
        Shows the frequency table, which displays each character and its frequency in each line.

      • treeToString

        public void treeToString()
        String represrntation of the HuffmanTree. Shows the preorder traversal of the tree.

      • lookupTableToString

        public void lookupTableToString()
        String representation of the lookup table. Shows each character and its value after encoded in each line.

      • showEverything

        public void showEverything()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This methods show the original text, the symbol frequency table, the Huffman Tree (include the 'symbol' and 'frequency' value for each node), the symbol/code table, the encoded message, the decoded message, and the average number of bits per symbol used in the encoded file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        The main method allows the user use JFileChooser to choose a file and do the Huffman coding, and then displays original text, freqeuncy table, encoded/decoded message, Huffman Tree, lookup table, and average number of bits per symbol used corresponding to the file.
        Parameters:
        args -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred
